itemDescription: First World War flying ace and victim of the Red Baron

wikipedia_page.main: Captain Sydney Philip Smith , (10 May 1896 – 6 April 1918) was a British First World War flying ace, who was credited with five aerial victories, before being shot down and killed, the 76th victory of Manfred von Richthofen.

response: * Sydney Philip Smith (1896–1918), World War I flying ace
* Sydney Philip Smith - World War I flying ace
| Victory shared with Donald MacLaren, Sydney Philip Smith, two other aces
*Sydney Philip Smith, pilot, was born in Aldershot
